An idea or notion; a unit of thought
A statement or formal explanation of the meaning of a concept
A note about the past state/use/meaning of a concept
Relates a resource (for example a concept) to a concept scheme in which it is included

Methods used to spatially locate geological features and exploration, mining and related infrastructure sites. These can be either features directly observed in the field (e.g. site/outcrop descriptions, structural readings, etc.) or obtained from legacy and current documents/datasets (e.g. airphotos, maps, previously published reports, exploration reports, etc.). Each location method has a spatial accuracy that indicates an estimate of the approximate error in the location. Captured geographical locations for geological or mining features are expressed as a set of coordinates (latitude and longitude degrees), with or without an elevation above or below sea level.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: Geographical location captured by using orthophotographs, i.e. aerial photos taken with a high-resolution camera that have been geometrically corrected to give a uniform scale. Captured as Map Grid of Australia (MGA) 1994 coordinates. Accuracy is typically within 5 m.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#hist.@value: Used by GSWA to capture locations of geological observations or exploration/mining/infrastructure sites.

https://prez.dev/description.@value: Geographical location captured by using orthophotographs, i.e. aerial photos taken with a high-resolution camera that have been geometrically corrected to give a uniform scale. Captured as Map Grid of Australia (MGA) 1994 coordinates. Accuracy is typically within 5 m.

https://prez.dev/label.@value: capture from panoramic image using orthophotograph (MGA)

https://prez.dev/description.@value: Geographical location of points marked on panoramic photographs using georeferenced orthophotographs, i.e. aerial photos taken with a high resolution camera that have been geometrically corrected to give a uniform scale. Typically used to position the location of specific geological features on cliff/scarp that cannot be accessed directly during mapping. Captured as Map Grid of Australia (MGA) 1994 coordinates. Accuracy is typically within 25 m.
A profile for SKOS Concept Schemes
A citation or reference to another creative work, such as another publication, web page, scholarly article, etc
